College: Rathinam Technical Campus Institute of Technology, Coimbatore
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Minimum Eligibility Marks for Candidates of HSC (Academic) and other equivalent exams:
Passed 10+2 examination with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the Chemistry / Biotechnology / Biology Obtained at least 45% marks (40% in case of candidate belonging to reserved category) in the above subjects taken together Community Minimum average marks in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry put together.
1. General Category – 50.00%
2. Backward Class including Backward Class Muslim – 45.00%
3. MBC & DNC – 40.00%
4. SC/SCA/ST – 40.00%
The above mentioned cut-off percentage is for the HSC (Academic) and other equivalent exams.
Minimum Eligibility Marks for Candidates of HSC (Vocational):
1. General Category – 50.00%
2. Backward Class including Backward Class Muslim – 45.00%
3. MBC & DNC – 40.00%
4. SC/SCA/ST – 40.00%
Important Points to Remember about TNEA Minimum Eligibility:
1. Candidates have to produce actual marks otherwise the minimum marks in Physics, Chemistry and Maths will be considered.
2.Improvement marks in board exams obtained by the candidates including Other State RALcandidates from 2006 onwards will not be considered.
For Lateral entry (Direct Second year)-
A) Passed Diploma examination from an AICTE approved institution; with at least 45% marks (40% in case of candidates belonging to reserved category) in appropriate branch of Engineering / Technology.
B) Passed B. Sc Degree from a recognized University as defined by UGC, with at least 45% marks (40% in case of candidates belonging to reserved category) and passed XII standard with mathematics as a subject.
C) Provided that in case of students belonging to B. Sc. Stream, shall clear the subjects of Engineering Graphics / Engineering Drawing and Engineering Mechanics of the first year engineering program along with the second year subjects.
D) Provided further that, the students belonging to B. Sc. Stream shall be considered only after filling the supernumerary seats in this category with students belonging to the Diploma stream.
E) Provided further that students, who have passed Diploma in Engineering & Technology from an AICTE approved institution or B. Sc Degree from a recognized University as defined by UGC, shall also be eligible for admission to the first year Engineering Degree courses subject to vacancies in the first year class in case the vacancies at lateral entry are exhausted. However the admissions shall be based strictly on the eligibility criteria as mentioned in A, B, D, and E above.
Course_Detail: This is a four year full time programme leading to a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from the Anna University, Chennai.

However the admissions shall be based strictly on the eligibility criteria as mentioned in A, B, D, and E above.
Course_Detail: This is a four year full time programme leading to a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from the Anna University, Chennai.

College: Rathinam Technical Campus Institute of Technology, Coimbatore
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Minimum Eligibility Marks for Candidates of HSC (Academic) and other equivalent exams:
Passed 10+2 examination with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the Chemistry / Biotechnology / Biology Obtained at least 45% marks (40% in case of candidate belonging to reserved category) in the above subjects taken together Community Minimum average marks in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry put together.
1. General Category – 50.00%
2. Backward Class including Backward Class Muslim – 45.00%
3. MBC & DNC – 40.00%
4. SC/SCA/ST – 40.00%
The above mentioned cut-off percentage is for the HSC (Academic) and other equivalent exams.
Minimum Eligibility Marks for Candidates of HSC (Vocational):
1. General Category – 50.00%
2. Backward Class including Backward Class Muslim – 45.00%
3. MBC & DNC – 40.00%
4. SC/SCA/ST – 40.00%
Important Points to Remember about TNEA Minimum Eligibility:
1. Candidates have to produce actual marks otherwise the minimum marks in Physics, Chemistry and Maths will be considered.
2.Improvement marks in board exams obtained by the candidates including Other State RALcandidates from 2006 onwards will not be considered.
For Lateral entry (Direct Second year)-
A) Passed Diploma examination from an AICTE approved institution; with at least 45% marks (40% in case of candidates belonging to reserved category) in appropriate branch of Engineering / Technology.
B) Passed B. Sc Degree from a recognized University as defined by UGC, with at least 45% marks (40% in case of candidates belonging to reserved category) and passed XII standard with mathematics as a subject.
C) Provided that in case of students belonging to B. Sc. Stream, shall clear the subjects of Engineering Graphics / Engineering Drawing and Engineering Mechanics of the first year engineering program along with the second year subjects.
D) Provided further that, the students belonging to B. Sc. Stream shall be considered only after filling the supernumerary seats in this category with students belonging to the Diploma stream.
E) Provided further that students, who have passed Diploma in Engineering & Technology from an AICTE approved institution or B. Sc Degree from a recognized University as defined by UGC, shall also be eligible for admission to the first year Engineering Degree courses subject to vacancies in the first year class in case the vacancies at lateral entry are exhausted. However the admissions shall be based strictly on the eligibility criteria as mentioned in A, B, D, and E above.
Course_Detail: This is a four year full time programme leading to a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from the Anna University, Chennai.

College: ITM College of Engineering, Nagpur
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
A candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std. XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Mathematics and any one from Chemistry or Biology or Bio-technology or Technical Vocational.
OR,
Secured minimum 50% marks i.e. not less than 150 marks out of 300 marks (45% marks i.e. not less than 135 marks out of 300 marks for backward class category candidates and Physically Handicapped from Maharashtra) in the Subjects Physics, Mathematics and any one from Chemistry or Biology or Bio-technology or Technical Vocational added together at HSC Std. XIIth.
OR,
Obtained Non Zero marks in “Common Entrance Test” MHT-CET-2016 for all Health Sciences, Engineering and Pharmacy degree courses for the academic year 2016-17 conducted by Government of Maharashtra.
Diploma/B.Sc. passed out students with 50% marks (45% for any category and disabled candidates) aspiring to take admission to BE First year are mandatory to appear for “Common Entrance Test” MHT-CET-2016 for all Health Sciences, Engineering and Pharmacy degree courses for the academic year 2016-17 conducted by Government of Maharashtra and should have secured non zero score.
For Lateral Entry
Candidate should be Indian National and should have passed Diploma course in Engineering / Technology with 50% for Open and 45% for any category in English medium, awarded by the Maharashtra State Board of Technical Education (MSBTE) or autonomous institution to which autonomy has been granted by the State of Maharashtra or Diploma recognized as equivalent to the diploma awarded by MSBTE for seeking direct admission to degree as prescribed by the
directorate of Technical Education Maharashtra

XIIth.

Lateral entry to second year-

[OR as may be amended by HSTES/ competent authority.]

College: Pune Vidhyarthi Griha's College of Engineering, Nashik
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Eligibility Criteria for Maharashtra State Candidate and outside Maharashtra State Candidate for admission to the First year of 4 year Degree courses in Engineering.
A candidate should be an India National and should havepassed the HSC (Std XII) examination of Maharashtra StateBoard of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education orIts equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics,Mathematics and Chemistry / Biology / BiotechnologyTechnical Vocation Subject.
AND
Secured minimum 50% marks i.e. not less than 150 marks out of 300 marks (45% marks i.e. not less than 135 marks out of 300 marks for backward class category candidates andpersons with Disability Candidate belonging to Maharashtrastate only) in the subjects Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry/ Biology / Biotechnology Technical Vocational Subject addedtogether at HSC (Std.XII)
AND
Obtained a positive composite i.e. marks obtained after adding 50% of JEE (Main) 2015 (Paper I) marks & 50% ofnormalized standard XII (Board or equivalent examination) inPhysics, Chemistry and Mathematics.For more details please login to the web site www.dtemaharashta.gov.in.
CRITERIA FOR DIRECT ADMISSION TO SECOND YEAR:
The candidate should have passed Diploma course in Engineering / Technology with 50% for Open and 45% for any category in English medium, awarded by the Maharashtra State Board of Technical Education (MSBTE) or autonomous institution to which autonomy has been granted by the State of Maharashtra or Diploma recognized as equivalent to the diploma awarded by MSBTE for seeking direct admission to degree as prescribed by DTE, Maharashtra.

College: Greater Noida College of Technology, Greater Noida
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Should pass intermediate examination of U. P. Board or 10+2 level examination or its equivalent from any recognized Board / University and securing minimum 45% marks (40% marks for SC/ST Category candidates) without grace in required each compulsory subjects (Physics and Mathematics) and one optional subject (Chemistry/ Bio-Technology / Biology / Technical Vocational subject) taken together.
B. Tech. - Second Year through UP-SEE 2017 / Lateral Entry
The vacant seats in B. Tech. (second year) shall be filled within 15 days of the last date of counseling at institute level, firstly by the qualified candidates of UPSEE-2015, who fulfill the eligibility or will be filled on merit by such candidates who have passed the qualifying examination securing minimum 50% (45% for SC/ST) marks in aggregate without any grace marks.
Course_Detail: This is a four-year full-time program leading to a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from the Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Technical University, Lucknow. This course approved by AICTE.

College: Vivekananda Institute of Technology East, Jaipur
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
1. The minimum academic qualification for admission to B. Tech. program in Rajasthan is a pass with at least 45% marks (40% marks in case of candidates belonging to “SC/ST/OBC (Non creamy layer)/SBC (Non Creamy layer)” of Rajasthan state) in the subjects combination of Physics and Maths as compulsory subjects along with one of the following subjects: Chemistry/ Biotechnology/Biology/ Computer Science, in the final examination of 10+2 (Class XII) of Board of Secondary Education, Rajasthan or any other examination recognized equivalent thereto by Board of Secondary Education, Rajasthan / Central Board of secondary Education (CBSE).
Admission in Engineering for direct lateral admissions to II Year B.Tech - The candidate should have passed Diploma with minimum of 45% marks (40% for SC/ST candidates of Rajasthan). The marks obtained to award the division in Diploma/Degree will be considered for deciding the eligibility and respective merit. Admission to the candidates will be given as per the following order of preference:
a. Candidates having passed Diploma from Board of Technical Education, Rajasthan, Jodhpur/ Universities in Rajasthan.
b. Bona-fide residents of Rajasthan (on submission of Certificate from competent authorities) having either passed diploma from institutions located in Rajasthan and considered equivalent by Board of Technical Education Rajasthan, Jodhpur or from Board of Technical Education in other States.
c. Candidates not covered in (2) above having passed Diploma from other State Boards of Technical Education.
Course_Detail: The Civil Engineering Department at VIT-East was established in the year 2008. The department is flourishing since then, with a Vision to achieve excellence in education by keeping pace with rapidly changing technologies and thereby, bridging the gap between academics and field practice in the area of civil engineering.

Eligiblity:
1. The minimum academic qualification for admission to Polytechnic Diploma in Rajasthan is a pass in the final examination of Class X of Board of Secondary Education, Rajasthan or any other examination recognized equivalent thereto by Board of Secondary Education, Rajasthan / Central Board of secondary Education (CBSE).
2. Age Limit : There is no criteria for taking admission in polytechnic college.
Admission in Diploma in Engineering for direct lateral admissions to II Year Diploma : The candidate should have passed 10+2 with minimum of 36% marks (for all categories) in the subjects combination of Physics & Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the following: Chemistry/ Biotechnology/ Biology/ Technical Vocational Subjects. Students who have passed 2-year course in ITI may also apply for lateral admissions. The marks obtained to award the division in Diploma will be considered for deciding the eligibility and respective merit.

College: Sarabhai Institute of Science and Technology, Thiruvananthapuram
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
a) The candidates having Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering in the appropriate branch with a minimum of 60% aggregate or equivalent.
b) Candidate having AmIE in the appropriate branch of Engineering with minimum of 60% aggregate or equivalent.
c) Candidate with Valid GATE Score.
d) The candidate will be selected from the list published by DTE.
e) Non GATE candidates will have to appear for a test/interviews conducted by the concerned Department, as per the direction given by the University.
f) Candidates who have degrees awarded from Universities other than KTU have to submit Migration Certificate also at the time of admission.
g) Candidates who have appeared for the final examination can also apply, provided he/she has passed all the subjects up to and including the 7th semester exam. Such candidates shall submit self attested copies of all mark lists up to 7th semester along with the application. Selection of such candidates shall be subject to the production of Certificates, satisfying clauses (a) to (e).
Course_Detail: The Courses leading to the degree of Master of Technology (M.Tech) in Software Engineering will span for a period of four Semesters (2 years). The span of a semester will be six months including the University examination.

College: Hi-Tech Institute of Technology, Aurangabad
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
(1) Maharashtra State Candidature Candidate.-
(i) The Candidate should be an Indian National.
(ii) Passed HSC or its equivalent examination with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the Chemistry or Biotechnology or Biology or Technical or Vocational subjects, and obtained at least 50% marks (at least 45% marks, in case of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only) in the above subjects taken together
Or
(ii) Passed Diploma in Engineering and Technology and obtained at least 50% marks (at least 45% marks, in case of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only)
Or
ii) Passed B.Sc. Degree from a Recognized University as defined by UGC and obtained at least 50% marks (at least 45% marks, in case of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only)
(iii) Obtained score in MHT-CET 2016 conducted by the Competent Authority.
(2) All India Candidature Candidates, Jammu and Kashmir Migrant Candidature Candidates.-
(i) The Candidate should be an Indian National;
(ii) Passed HSC or its equivalent examination with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the Chemistry or Biotechnology or Biology or Technical or Vocational subjects and obtained at least 50% marks (at least 45% marks, in case of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only) in the above subjects taken together;
Or
(ii) Passed Diploma in Engineering and Technology and obtained at least 50% marks (at least 45% marks, in case of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only)
Or
ii) Passed B.Sc. Degree from a Recognized University as defined by University Grants Commission and obtained at least 50% marks (at least 45% marks, in case of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only)
(iii) Obtained score in MHT-CET 2016 or JEE Main Paper I.
Direct Second Year Engineering:
The Candidate must be an Indian National and should have passed Post-SSC or Post-HSC Diploma Course in Engineering/Technology with at least 45.00 % marks (40.00 % marks for backward class categories and Physically Handicapped belonging only to Maharashtra State) in appropriate branch of Engineering / Technology.
Course_Detail: Bachelor of Engineering in Civil Engineering is four years (8 Semester) full-time undergraduate engineering program offered by Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University, Aurangabad and approved by AICTE.

(ii) Must not be more than 21 years of age or must not be less than 17 years of age on 1st of August of the year in which the admission is sought. Upper age limit is relaxable to 22 years in case of B.Sc. passed candidates. For SC/ST candidate upper age limit may be relaxed by 3 years.
(iii) Must be mentally and physically fit and must possess a good moral character
For Lateral Entry Admission
1) Must have passed the Diploma in engineering in the relevant branch with a minimum of 50% marks in aggregate. Candidatesfulfilling these conditions would only be eligible for appearing in the entrance test meant for selection of Diploma holders for lateral entry to degree programmes. The selection of candidates will be based on merit of the entrance test. ii) Must be mentally and physically fit and must possess a good moral character.
Course_Detail: Bachelor of Technology in Electrical Engineering is four years full time undergraduate engineering course offered by Gauhati University, Guwahati and approve by AICTE.

Eligiblity:

Outside State Candidates are not eligible for Lateral admission to 3rd Semester.

College: KDK College of Engineering, Umrer
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
For Maharashtra State Candidate and Outside Maharashtra State Candidate for admission to the first year of degree course in Engineering /Technology-
Candidate should be an Indian national and should have passed the HSC examination of Maharashtra state board of secondary and higher secondary education or its equivalent examination with subjects English , physics , chemistry and mathematics and secured minimum 50% marks i.e. not less than 150 marks out of 300 marks (minimum 45% marks i.e. not less than 135 marks out of 300 marks in case of candidate of Backward Class categories belonging only to Maharashtra State) in the subjects physics , chemistry and mathematics added together and obtained a non zero score in physics , chemistry and mathematics added together at MHT-CET.
For All India (JEE Main) Candidates- Candidate should be an Indian national and should have passed the HSC examination of Maharashtra state board of secondary and higher secondary education or its equivalent examination with subjects English , physics , chemistry and mathematics and secured minimum 50% marks i.e. not less than 150 marks out of 300 marks (minimum 45% marks i.e. not less than 135 marks out of 300 marks in case of candidate of Backward Class categories belonging only to Maharashtra State) in the subjects physics , chemistry and mathematics added together and candidate should have a valid AIEEE score(i.e. total score should be positive).
Direct Second Year Engineering- Diploma holder who have passed the diploma course in Engineering /Technology Affiliated to MSBTE or its equivalent with minimum 60% marks can take admission to direct the second year of engineering.
Course_Detail: This is a four year year full time course of KDK College of Engineering, Umrer and course is approved by AICTE, and affiliated to Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University, Nagpur

College: Smt Manoramabai Mundle College of Architecture, Nagpur
Approval: COA
Eligiblity:
A candidate who has passed 10 + 2 examination and has secured not less than 50% marks in aggregate with mathematics as subject of examination shall be eligible for admission to the first year of B.Arch. course.
OR
10 + 3 Diploma (any stream) recognized by Central / State Governments with 50% aggregate marks.
OR
International Baccalaureate Diploma, after 10 years of schooling, with not less than 50% marks aggregate and with Mathematics as compulsory subject of examination.All admissions to Bachelor of Architecture degree course shall be subject to the scoring of at least 80 out of 200 marks in the National Aptitude Test in Architecture (NATA) conducted by the Council of Architecture.Merit list will be prepared considering sum of 50 percentage weightage of the aggregate marks of all subjects of the qualifying examination and the 50% weightage of the valid NATA Score.

College: Proudadevaraya Institute of Technology, Hospet

Eligiblity:
The student should have passed Karnataka 2nd PUC /12th standard or equivalent examination with Physics and Mathematics along with Chemistry / Bio-Technology / Computer Science / Electronics / Biology as optional subjects with English as one of the languages of study and obtained a minimum of 45% of marks in aggregate in the optional subjects. In case of candidates belonging to Karnataka Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and other Backward Classes (Category I, 2A,2B, 3A and 3B), the minimum marks for the purpose of eligibility will be 40% of marks in aggregate in the optional subjects in the qualifying examination.

College: Suman Ramesh Tulsiani Technical Campus Faculty of Engineering, Pune
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the SSC (Std.X) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary Education or its equivalent, with subjects Maths/Mathematics, General Science and English, with minimum 35% aggregate marks	The candidates who have passed SSC Examination prior to March 2009, the aggregate marks shall be grand total of marks obtained by the candidate in any 5 subjects where he/she has scored maximum marks.
The candidates who have passed SSC Examination after March 2009, the aggregate marks shall be total marks of 5 subjects taken into consideration and mentioned on the Mark sheet.
Candidates who have passed Maths/Mathematics (Code 71 for Maharashtra State Board candidates) and Science & Technology (Code 72 for Maharashtra State Board candidates) are only eligible for admission
In case marks against sports activities are given on the marksheet, these shall be added to the aggregate marks for deciding merit
Course_Detail: Diploma in Civil Engineering is a three year full time course approved by AICTE and affiliated by Maharashtra State Board of Technical Education, Mumbai

Note: If a candidate has appeared in six subjects in the qualifying examination, the subject (fifth or sixth) with better marks will be considered.
2. He / She should have possessed a valid rank in JEE (Main).

Eligiblity:
Passed the HSC (Std. XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with Mathematics as a subject and secured minimum 50% aggregate marks (45% for backward class candidates from Maharashtra State only) in the HSC (Std XII) examination.
OR
Passed Diploma in under 10+3 diploma (any stream) Examination recognised by central/ state government or its equivalent examination and secured minimum 50% aggregate marks. (45% for backward class candidates)
AND
Hold valid score at National Aptitude Test in Architecture (NATA) conducted by the Council of Architecture for the academic year 2016-2017 (with minimum 40% valid score.)
Course_Detail: The five-year full-time course of The Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University, Nagpur leading to a degree of B.Arch. is running and approved by Council of Architecture, New Delhi.

College: Manoharbhai Patel Institute of Engineering and Technology, Gondia
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Eligibility Criteria for All India (Paper-I of JEE Main 2016 qualified) Candidates:
Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics AND secured minimum 50% marks (minimum 45% marks in case of candidates of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability belonging only to Maharashtra State) in the subjects Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics added together AND Candidate should have a valid JEE Main 2016 Score (i.e. total score should be positive) for the year 2016-2017.
Note: Maharashtra Candidates having valid JEE Main 2016 score and appearing for MTCET 2016 will be required to submit single Application and Option form for the CAP. Such candidates will be given single allotment through CAP as per inter-se-merit.
Eligibility Criteria for Foreign National/Foreign Student/ PIO/Children of Indian workers in the Gulf countries/ Children of NRI
Candidate should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics and secured minimum 50% marks in the subjects Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics added together.
• The eligibility of the candidates passing the HSC (Std. XII) equivalent examination from a school/college/Examination Board situated outside India shall be further decided by the University Authorities to which the candidate is admitted. Hence such candidates are advised to get their eligibility verified by the respective University Authorities before seeking admission to the Engineering courses in the State of Maharashtra.
• The candidate belonging to this type is not required to appear for the MT-CET 2016/ JEE Main 2016.
Eligibility criteria for GoI Nominees:
Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics and secured minimum 50% marks (minimum 40% marks in case of candidates of Backward class categories) in the subjects Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics added together.
• The candidate belonging to this type is required to appear for the MT-CET 2016/ JEE Main 2016.
Eligibility criteria for J & K Migrant candidates:
Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics and secured minimum 50% marks in the subjects Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics added together.
Direct Second Year B.E. (Diploma Holder)
For Diploma Holders in Engineering/Technology awarded by Maharashtra Govt. or its equivalent having First Division and above can be admitted directly to Third Semester B.E. However, Diploma Holders in Engineering or Technology with Second Division marks can be admitted directly to B.E. 1st year.
Course_Detail: Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.) in Civil Engineering is a four year full-time undergraduate program recognised by AICTE and affiliated to the The Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University, Nagpur.

Note: Maharashtra Candidates having valid JEE Main 2016 score and appearing for MTCET 2016 will be required to submit single Application and Option form for the CAP. Such candidates will be given single allotment through CAP as per inter-se-merit.
Eligibility Criteria for Foreign National/Foreign Student/ PIO/Children of Indian workers in the Gulf countries/ Children of NRI
Candidate should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics and secured minimum 50% marks in the subjects Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics added together.
• The eligibility of the candidates passing the HSC (Std. XII) equivalent examination from a school/college/Examination Board situated outside India shall be further decided by the University Authorities to which the candidate is admitted. Hence such candidates are advised to get their eligibility verified by the respective University Authorities before seeking admission to the Engineering courses in the State of Maharashtra.
• The candidate belonging to this type is not required to appear for the MT-CET 2016/ JEE Main 2016.
Eligibility criteria for GoI Nominees:
Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics and secured minimum 50% marks (minimum 40% marks in case of candidates of Backward class categories) in the subjects Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics added together.
• The candidate belonging to this type is required to appear for the MT-CET 2016/ JEE Main 2016.
Eligibility criteria for J & K Migrant candidates:
Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics and secured minimum 50% marks in the subjects Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics added together.
Direct Second Year B.E. (Diploma Holder)
For Diploma Holders in Engineering/Technology awarded by Maharashtra Govt. or its equivalent having First Division and above can be admitted directly to Third Semester B.E. However, Diploma Holders in Engineering or Technology with Second Division marks can be admitted directly to B.E. 1st year.
Course_Detail: Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.) in Information Technology is a four year full-time undergraduate program recognised by AICTE and affiliated to the The Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University, Nagpur.

College: Jai Narain College of Technology and Science, Bhopal
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
1st Year XII with : Phy + Maths + (Chem. / Comp. Sc./Bio) with Min. 50% (45 % for SC/ST/OBC) with qualified rank in PET.
The branch wise intakes are reserved for State Quota, All India Quota & Management Quota. The percentages of various quotas are decided by the State Government. However, the current proportions are State Quota: 75%, All India Quota: 10% and Management Quota: 15%. For admission under State Quota, a candidate is expected to qualify in PET conducted by Professional Examination Board, Chhattisgarh (CGVYAPAM). Thereafter, candidates having domicile of Chhattisgarh State are called for counseling by Directorate of Technical Education, Govt. of Chhattisgarh and according to availability at the time of counseling seats are allotted. For admission under All India Quota, a candidate is expected to qualify in JEE conducted by CBSE, New Delhi. Thereafter, candidates are called for counseling by Directorate of Technical Education, Govt. of Chhattisgarh and according to availability at the time of counseling seats are allotted. For admission under Management Quota, a candidate is expected to qualify either in PET conducted by Professional Examination Board, Chhattisgarh (CGVYAPAM) or JEE conducted by CBSE, New Delhi. Advertisement is placed in Newspapers and also in the website for admission (after the declaration of the results of the entrance examinations) under Management Quota and the list is finalized strictly based on merit of the entrance examinations.
Course_Detail: B.Tech Civil Engineering is a full-time four years duration course Affiliated to Rajiv Gandhi Proudyogiki Vishwavidyalaya and Approved by AICTE.

College: Helapuri Institute of Technology and Science, Eluru
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Admissions under Convenor's Quota (70% of intake in each branch): A Candidate for admission to the four-year degree course in Engineering must have passed the Intermediate examination of the Board of Intermediate Education, Government of Andhra Pradesh with Mathematics, Physics, and Chemistry as optional subjects, or any other examination recognized by the JNTUK University as equivalent thereto.All the eligible applicants for admission into First Year shall have to qualify in the EAMCET Examination conducted by the Govt. of AP. The candidates will be admitted strictly in accordance with the merit secured at the Entrance Examination keeping in view the rules in force regarding the reservations of seats of various categories of candidates. The candidates should satisfy local/non-local status requirement as laid down in the AP Educational institutions (Regulation of Admissions) Order 1974 as amended from time to time.
Admissions under Management Quota (30% of intake in each branch): The seats shall be filled either on the basis of rank obtained in EAMCET or of securing not less than 50% in aggregate or in group subjects (Maths, Physics, and Chemistry) in the 10+2 qualifying examination.
Course_Detail: Bachelor of Technology in Civil Engineering is four years (8 Semester) full-time undergraduate engineering program offered by Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, Kakinada and approved by AICTE.

Admission under the lateral entry scheme: Candidates having a three years Diploma in the concerned discipline with 50% marks from AICTE recognized institutions are eligible for admission in the respective branches directly to the 2nd year (3rd semester) of BE programme. The students thus admitted are required to clear foundation subjects as per the ordinance of the CSVTU, Bhilai.
OR,
Candidates having a B.Sc. degree with 50% marks from any recognized university with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics as compulsory subjects are also eligible for admission to BE 2nd Year directly. The students thus admitted are required to clear foundation subjects as per the ordinance of the CSVTU, Bhilai.
Course_Detail: B.Tech Computer Science and Engineering is a full-time four years duration course Affiliated to Chhattisgarh Swami Vivekanand Technical University, Bhilai Approved by AICTE.

College: C Byregowda Institute of Technology, Kolar
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
The students are admitted to the C. Byregowda Institute of Technology on merit, as per the directives of the Government of Karnataka from time to time, both to the Government Quota and the Management Quota.
Pass in 10+2/Higher secondary(HS)/Pre-university(PUC)/’A’ Level (with 12 years of schooling) or its equivalent with English as one of the language,shall have secured a minimum of 45% marks in aggregate in physics,mathematics and any one of the following i.e Chemistry,Biology,Bio-technology,Computer science,Electronics,Information science.
The candidates who belongs to Karnataka schedule caste,schedule tribe and other backward categories i.e 2A,2B,3A & 3B,the minimum marks for the purpose of eligibility will be 40% of marks in aggregate in the optional subjects in the qualifying examinations.
CBIT admits as per prevailing rules & regulations of VTU, Belgaum.The fee structure is as per the norms prescribed by the Government of Karnataka. Note that the students will legally bind any revision in the fees and admission procedure
Course_Detail: B.Tech Civil Engineering is a full-time four years duration course Affiliated to Visvesvaraya Technological University, Belgaum and Approved by AICTE.

College: BRCM College of Engineering and Technology, Bhiwani
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
1st Year(JEE): Passed 10+2 Examination with Physics & Mathematics as compulsory subjects alongwith one of the Chemistry / Bio-Technology / Biology / Computer. Obtained at least 45% marks (42.75% in case of candidate belonging to SC category) in the above subjects taken together. Admission will be according to JEE ranking.
2nd Year(LEET): Passed Diploma Examination from an AICTE approved institution with at least 45% marks (42.75% in case of SC category candidate) in appropriate branch of Engineering/Technology or B Sc. Degree with Mathematics from UGC defined university with 45% marks. Admission will be according to LEET ranking.
Course_Detail: B.Tech Civil Engineering is a full-time four years duration course Affiliated to Maharshi Dayanand University, Rohtak and Approved by AICTE.

College: Ammini College of Engineering, Palakkad
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
1. Candidates who have passed Higher Secondary Examination, Kerala, or Examinations recognized as equivalent thereto, with 50% marks in Mathematics separately, and 50 % marks in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry put together are eligible for admission.
2. In case, the candidate has not studied Chemistry, the marks obtained in Computer Science shall be considered.In case, the candidate has not studied Chemistry and Computer Science, the marks obtained in Biotechnology shall be considered. In case, the candidate has not studied Chemistry, Computer Science and Biotechnology, the marks obtained in Biology shall be considered.
3. The marks as shown in the mark list of the Board Examination obtained from the respective Higher Secondary Board shall be considered for academic eligibility.
4. Candidates who have Diploma in Engineering awarded by the Board of Technical Examinations, or an examination recognised equivalent thereto, by the State Board of Technical Education after undergoing an institutional course of at least 3 years from an Institution approved by AICTE, securing a minimum of 50% marks in the final year Diploma Examination are eligible for admission to the special reservation quota (DE).
5. The Vocational Higher Secondary Examination, Kerala, has been recognised as equivalent to the Higher Secondary Examination, Kerala.
Age Limit : Applicants should have completed 17 years of age as on the 31st December 2015. No relaxation in the minimum age will be allowed. There is no upper age limit.
For Management Quota Seat :
1. Candidates who have passed Higher Secondary Examination, Kerala, or Examinations recognized as equivalent thereto, with 50% marks in Mathematics separately, and 50% marks in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry / Bio-technology / Computer Science / Biology put together are eligible for admission.
2. If an applicant is found ineligible for whatever reasons even after admission into the Program, his/her admission will be cancelled. All admissions will be subject to verification of facts from the original Certificates / documents of the applicants. The decision of the Admissions Committee regarding eligibility of any applicant shall be final. For genuine reasons, management will have the right to deny admission to Management / NRI quota to any candidate even if otherwise eligible.
For NRI Quota Seat :
1. NRI seats will be offered to the children / ward / dependent of NRI, based on their total percentage of marks for Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry in the 12th Std. examinations, if they satisfy the stipulations of the Government of Kerala, AICTE and the University of Calicut.
2. Children of NRI will be given first priority.
3. Candidates who have passed Higher Secondary Examination, Kerala, or Examinations recognized as equivalent thereto, with 50% marks in Mathematics separately, and 50% marks in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry/Bio-technology/Computer Science /Biology put together are eligible for admission.
4. Applications should be supported by valid documents showing that the candidate is a child / ward / dependent of NRI.

College: Ammini College of Engineering, Palakkad
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
1. Candidates who have passed Higher Secondary Examination, Kerala, or Examinations recognized as equivalent thereto, with 50% marks in Mathematics separately, and 50 % marks in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry put together are eligible for admission.
2. In case, the candidate has not studied Chemistry, the marks obtained in Computer Science shall be considered.In case, the candidate has not studied Chemistry and Computer Science, the marks obtained in Biotechnology shall be considered. In case, the candidate has not studied Chemistry, Computer Science and Biotechnology, the marks obtained in Biology shall be considered.
3. The marks as shown in the mark list of the Board Examination obtained from the respective Higher Secondary Board shall be considered for academic eligibility.
4. Candidates who have Diploma in Engineering awarded by the Board of Technical Examinations, or an examination recognised equivalent thereto, by the State Board of Technical Education after undergoing an institutional course of at least 3 years from an Institution approved by AICTE, securing a minimum of 50% marks in the final year Diploma Examination are eligible for admission to the special reservation quota (DE).
5. The Vocational Higher Secondary Examination, Kerala, has been recognised as equivalent to the Higher Secondary Examination, Kerala.

OR Passed B.Sc. Degree from a University Grants Commission (UGC) or Association of Indian Universities recognized University with at least 45% marks (40% in case of candidates of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability belonging to Maharashtra State only) and passed HSC with Mathematics as a subject Provided that students belonging to this category shall clear the subjects of Engineering Graphics/ Engineering Drawing and Engineering Mechanics of the first year Engineering Program along with second year subjects.
Any other criterion declared by appropriate authority from time to time

College: HKE Society's SLN College of Engineering, Raichur
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
The candidate shall have passed the second year Pre-University or XII Standard or equivalent examinations held preceding the entrance test with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory Subjects, along with one of the following subjects :- Chemistry, Bio-Technology, Computer Science, Biology, Electronics and has secured not less than Forty Five (45%) percent of the aggregate marks in optional subjects with English as one of the Language for admission to Engineering & Technology Courses.
Provided further that the minimum marks for the purpose of eligibility shall be Forty percent (40%) of aggregate in optional subjects in case of candidates belonging to the **Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and other Backward Classes Specified in the relevant Government order for the purpose of reservation in respect of Engineering and Technology Courses.

College: St Thomas Institute for Science and Technology, Thiruvananthapuram
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
a) Applicant must be an Indian National
b) Applicant shall have studied the Graduate course in an Institution approved by AICTE/Deemed Universities.
c) Candidates should have a minimum of 60% aggregate marks in the Engineering Degree Examination. For SC/ST candidates a pass in the Engineering Degree course is sufficient.
d) The Degree shall be in Civil Engineering
e) Candidates, who have passed AMIE / AMIETE Examinations and satisfying the following conditions, are eligible for admission. i. They must have valid GATE Score ii. A minimum of 55% marks for section B in AMIE / AMIETE examination. iii. Minimum three years of Professional experience in the field of specialization acquiring after the qualifying degree.
f) Candidates who have appeared for the final semester examination can also apply, provided he/she has passed all the subjects of qualifying degree at the time of admission.
g) In case seats remain vacant due to lack of candidates with valid GATE score, candidates from Kerala State without valid GATE score will be considered against such vacancies. If seats are still remaining vacant,candidates from other States will be considered for admission.
Course_Detail: M.Tech Geotechnical Engineering is a full-time 2-years duration course Affiliated to University of Kerala, Thiruvananthapuram and Approved by AICTE.

College: Vijnan Institute of Science and Technology, Ernakulam
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Candidates who have passed Higher Secondary Examination, Kerala, or Examinations recognized as equivalent thereto, with 50% marks in Mathematics separately, and 50 % marks in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry put together are eligible for admission. However candidates who have obtained 45% marks in Mathematics separately with 60% aggregate marks in Physics and Chemistry put together are also eligible for admission. In case, the candidate has not studied Chemistry, the marks obtained in Computer Science shall be considered. In case, the candidate has not studied Chemistry and Computer Science, the marks obtained in Biotechnology shall be considered. In case, the candidate has not studied Chemistry, Computer Science and Biotechnology, the marks obtained in Biology shall be considered. The marks as shown in the mark list of the Board of Examination obtained from the respective Higher Secondary Board shall be considered for academic eligibility.
Note:-
(i) In two year Kerala Higher Secondary courses or examinations recognized equivalent thereto with two year course where the Board Examinations are conducted in both years, the total marks of two years in the respective subjects as shown in the mark lists of the respective Higher Secondary Boards will be considered for academic eligibility.
(ii) In Higher Secondary courses or examinations recognized equivalent thereto where Board Examinations are conducted only at the end of 12th class (final year), the marks in the respective subjects as shown in the mark lists of the respective Higher Secondary Boards will be considered for academic eligibility.
(iii) For all other type of Higher Secondary courses or examinations recognized equivalent thereto, the marks of the respective subjects as shown in the mark list of the respective Board of Examinations will be considered for academic eligibility.
Candidates who have passed Higher Secondary Examination, Kerala, or examinations recognized as equivalent thereto, with 50 % marks in Mathematics/Biology separately, and 50 % marks in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics/Biology put together are eligible for admission to the seats reserved for Dairy Farm Instructors of Dairy Development Department for B.Tech. (D.Sc. & Tech). However, the candidates admitted to the course have to take a make-up course in Basic Mathematics (2+0) credits or Applied Biology (1+1) credit as the case may be.
The candidates who obtain admission and discontinued studies after the closing of admission in the same year or in subsequent years are liable to pay the tuition fee and special fee for the remaining period of the course as liquidated damages.

HSC (Std,XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, PCM and secured minimum 45% marks i.e. 135 marks out of 300 marks in the subjects PCM added together or 40%marks i.e. 120 marks out of 300 marks for backward class category for candidates from Maharashtra.
Common Entrance Test (CET) conducted by the competent authority. or
Eligibility Criteria To Direct Second Year B.E.
The candidate should have passed with minimum 50% marks (45% marks in case of candidates of backword class categories belonging only to Maharashtra State)in diploma course in Engineering or Technology of the MSBTE or autonomous institution to which autonomy has been granted by the State of Maharashtra OR diploma recognized as equivalent to the diploma awarded by MSBTE with English medium. OR The candidate should have passed B.Sc. Degree with minimum 50% marks (45% marks in case of candidates of backword class categories belonging only to Maharashtra State).

College: Srinivasa College of Engineering and Technology, East Godavari
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
A bachelor’s degree in Engg/Technology of any recognized university in the concerned discipline.
AMIE/AMIETE or similar qualifications recognized by UPSC as equivalent to B.E./B.Tech
Valid GATE Score obtained in the GATE Examination.
Valid PGECET Rank obtained in the Entrance Examination
Apart from requirements of qualifications as stated in the above, the admissions of sponsored candidates shall be taken.
The number of Sponsored candidates shall not be more than two in each specialization and not more than five in each department.
His/Her application shall be duly recommended by the sponsoring agency for admission to the course and forwarded to the JNTUK. These seats are considered as supernumerary.
He/She must be permanent employee with the sponsoring agency for at least 2 years, after obtaining the qualifying degree
The sponsoring agency must be a Government establishment or a public-sector undertaking, or a reputed private undertaking.
The sponsoring agency shall-certify that the candidates will be granted leave for pursuing the M.Tech. Full-Time course
The candidates should satisfy local/non-local status requirement as laid down in the AP Educational institutions (Regulation of Admissions) Order 1974 as amended from time to time.

College: Shreeyash College of Engineering and Technology, Aurangabad
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
1. For Maharashtra State Candidate and Outside Maharashtra State Candidate : Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of  Maharashtra  State  Board  of  Secondary  and  Higher  Secondary  Education  or  its  equivalent examination  with  subjects  English,  Physics,  Mathematics  and  Chemistry/Biotechnology /Biology/ Technical Vocational subject.
And
Secured minimum 50 % marks (minimum 45 % marks, in case of Backward class categories and  Persons  with  Disability  candidates  belonging  to  Maharashtra  State  only)  in the subjectsPhysics, Mathematics and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/ Technical Vocational subject added together.
And
Obtained a positive Composite score i.e., marks obtained  after adding 50% of JEE (Main) (Paper 1) marks and 50% of normalized Standard XII (Board or  Equivalent Examination) marks in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics.
2. For All India Candidates :
Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of Maharashtra  State  Board  of  Secondary  and  Higher  Secondary  Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry/Biotechnology /Biology/ Technical Vocational subject.
And
Secured minimum 50 % marks (minimum 45 % marks, in case of Backward class categories and  Persons  with  Disability  candidates  belonging  to  Maharashtra  State only) in the subjects Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/ Technical Vocational subject added together.
AND
Obtained All India Rank in JEE (Main) (Paper 1) given by CBSE.
Course_Detail: Bachelor of Engineering in Civil Engineering is four-year duration full-time course affiliated to Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Marathwada University, Aurangabad & Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Technological University, Lonere and approved by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).

For Maharashtra State Candidate and Outside Maharashtra State Candidate : Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of  Maharashtra  State  Board  of  Secondary  and  Higher  Secondary  Education  or  its  equivalent examination  with  subjects  English,  Physics,  Mathematics  and  Chemistry/Biotechnology /Biology/ Technical Vocational subject.
And
Secured minimum 50 % marks (minimum 45 % marks, in case of Backward class categories and  Persons  with  Disability  candidates  belonging  to  Maharashtra  State  only)  in the subjectsPhysics, Mathematics and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/ Technical Vocational subject added together.
And
Obtained a positive Composite score i.e., marks obtained  after adding 50% of JEE (Main) (Paper 1) marks and 50% of normalized Standard XII (Board or  Equivalent Examination) marks in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics.
2. For All India Candidates :
Candidate should be an Indian National and should have passed the HSC (Std.XII) examination of Maharashtra  State  Board  of  Secondary  and  Higher  Secondary  Education or its equivalent examination with subjects English, Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry/Biotechnology /Biology/ Technical Vocational subject.
And
Secured minimum 50 % marks (minimum 45 % marks, in case of Backward class categories and  Persons  with  Disability  candidates  belonging  to  Maharashtra  State only) in the subjects Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/ Technical Vocational subject added together.
AND
Obtained All India Rank in JEE (Main) (Paper 1) given by CBSE.
